articles.headline: Top Engineers Shun Military; Concern Grows
articles.snippet: As engineers seek higher pay at civilian companies, the Pentagon is losing the people it needs to manage projects.
articles.abstract: As engineers seek higher pay at civilian companies, the Pentagon is losing the people it needs to manage projects.
articles.lead_paragraph: When Paul G. Kaminski completed his graduate work in 1971 with degrees from M.I.T. and Stanford, he started building advanced airplanes for the Air Force. By the time he stopped several decades later, he had played a pivotal role in producing a flock of new weapons, including radar-evading stealth aircraft.

articles.headline: High Medicare Costs, Courtesy of Congress
articles.snippet: Medicare pays $110 for a walker that Wal-Mart sells for $60, and medical equipment makers like it that way.
articles.abstract: Medicare pays $110 for a walker that Wal-Mart sells for $60, and medical equipment makers like it that way.
articles.lead_paragraph: On Wal-Mart’s Web site, you can buy a walker for $59.92. It is called the Carex Explorer, and it’s a typical walker: a few feet high, with four metal poles extending to the ground. The Explorer is one of the walkers covered by Medicare.

articles.headline: Hidden Sex Scenes Draw Ho-Hum, Except From Lawyers
articles.snippet: Few plaintiffs joined a class action suit brought against the video game Grand Theft Auto: San Andreas, which contained sex scenes buried in its software.
articles.abstract: Few plaintiffs joined a class action suit brought against the video game Grand Theft Auto: San Andreas, which contained sex scenes buried in its software.
articles.lead_paragraph: Lawyers who sued the makers of the video game Grand Theft Auto: San Andreas profess to be shocked, simply shocked, that few people who bought the game were offended by sex scenes buried in its software.

articles.headline: Approval Is Near for Bill to Help U.S. Homeowners
articles.snippet: Congress is poised to pass a huge package of housing legislation, including a refinancing plan aimed at rescuing homeowners in danger of foreclosure.
articles.abstract: Congress is poised to pass a huge package of housing legislation, including a refinancing plan aimed at rescuing homeowners in danger of foreclosure.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON  With sinking home values continuing to drag down the economy, Congress is poised to approve a huge package of housing legislation, including a refinancing program aimed at rescuing hundreds of thousands of homeowners in danger of foreclosure and the most sweeping government overhaul of mortgage financing since the New Deal.

articles.headline: Albanian Custom Fades: Woman as Family Man
articles.snippet: The sworn virgin is disappearing in Albania as sexual equality and modernity come to the country.
articles.abstract: The sworn virgin is disappearing in Albania as sexual equality and modernity come to the country.
articles.lead_paragraph: KRUJE, Albania  Pashe Keqi recalled the day nearly 60 years ago when she decided to become a man. She chopped off her long black curls, traded in her dress for her father’s baggy trousers, armed herself with a hunting rifle and vowed to forsake marriage, children and sex.

articles.headline: Illinois to Sue Countrywide
articles.snippet: The state says the lender defrauded borrowers by selling mortgages that soon went into foreclosure.
articles.abstract: The state says the lender defrauded borrowers by selling mortgages that soon went into foreclosure.
articles.lead_paragraph: The Illinois attorney general is suing Countrywide Financial, the troubled mortgage lender, and Angelo R. Mozilo, its chief executive, contending that the company and its executives defrauded borrowers in the state by selling them costly and defective loans that quickly went into foreclosure.

articles.headline: Congress Looks for a Culprit for Rising Oil Prices
articles.snippet: A pre-eminent energy expert is to testify on Wednesday before lawmakers that the suspicion that investors are a large cause for skyrocketing oil prices is misguided.
articles.abstract: A pre-eminent energy expert is to testify on Wednesday before lawmakers that the suspicion that investors are a large cause for skyrocketing oil prices is misguided.
articles.lead_paragraph: With Americans growing angrier by the day about high gasoline prices, nobody can accuse Congress of turning a deaf ear.

articles.headline: Dow Chemical Raises Prices for Second Time in a Month
articles.snippet: Dow said that it was raising prices for the second time in a month, as well as introducing freight surcharges and reducing production to offset ever-rising energy costs.
articles.abstract: Dow said that it was raising prices for the second time in a month, as well as introducing freight surcharges and reducing production to offset ever-rising energy costs.
articles.lead_paragraph: The Dow Chemical Company said Tuesday that it was raising prices for the second time in a month to offset a “relentless rise” in energy costs, a sign that companies may increasingly have to pass on price increases to their customers.

articles.headline: Florida Buying Big Sugar Tract for Everglades
articles.snippet: The dream of a restored Everglades moved a step closer to reality when the nation’s largest sugarcane producer agreed to sell all of its assets to the state.
articles.abstract: The dream of a restored Everglades moved a step closer to reality when the nation’s largest sugarcane producer agreed to sell all of its assets to the state.
articles.lead_paragraph: LOXAHATCHEE, Fla.  The dream of a restored Everglades, with water flowing from Lake Okeechobee to Florida Bay, moved a giant step closer to reality on Tuesday when the nation’s largest sugarcane producer agreed to sell all of its assets to the state and go out of business.
